title: Cleg Kelly, arab of the city,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: It became a standing taunt as far as the Arch of Abbeyhill for a month, " I'll send Big Smith till ye ! " And there was not a Knuckle Duster that did not hang his head at the remembrance. The Pleasance was naturally very proud of its missionary, and offered long odds on him as against any missionary in the town. " He could lick them a' wi' his hand tied ahint his back," said the Pleasance in its wholly reasonable pride.

" Hecould lick them a' wi' his hand tied ahint his back," saidthe Pleasance in its wholly reasonable pride.
